quote: These data show that influenza virus A/Indonesia/5/05 potentially requires only a single amino acid substitution to acquire human receptor specificity, while at the same time remaining replication competent

The data presented here show that receptor specificity of HA of the IND05 virus can be changed by introducing a single amino acid substitution in the receptor-binding domain, resulting in replication competent viruses that attach abundantly to the human upper respiratory tract.

Twelve nucleotides encoding four amino acid residues (underlined) making up the multibasic cleavage site PQRER/SRRKKRG in the HA gene of influenza virus VN04 and IND05 were removed as described previously (37), so viruses containing these HA genes were no longer considered highly pathogenic.
there have been several reports of HPAI H5N1 viruses with increased affinity for the human influenza A virus receptor, α2,6-linked SA, in combination with residual affinity for α2,3-linked SA

quote: Ingroup III, the mutants IND05-HA N182K... agglutinated only /H92512,6-TRBC and not /H92512,3-TRBC, despite the fact that these amino acid substitutions or combinations thereof were described to have dual receptor binding in their original background (29, 39).

effect: Enhanced binding affinity to mammalian cells
quote: The remaining mutants—IND05-HA N182K , IND05-HAQ222L,G224S , and IND05-HAN182K,Q222L,G224S —all showed abundant attachment to ciliated epithelial cells in the nasal turbinates, like the human NL03 virus (Table 3 and Fig. 1), but did not show similarly abundant attachment to the trachea or type I pneumocytes in the alveoli.

The mutant viruses attached less abundantly than the NL03 virus to the ciliated epithelial cells of the trachea ... In the alveoli, all three mutant viruses attached to type I pneumocytes, a finding in agreement with attachment of the NL03 virus and in contrast with the attachment of the IND05 virus to type II pneumocytes ... H5 viruses with altered receptor specificity are replication competent.

IND05-HAQ222L,G224S , or IND05-HAN182K,Q222L,G224S were produced. ... The substitution/deletion at position 153 of HA resulted in decreased receptor binding but not in a shift in receptor specificity from /H92512,6-linked SA to /H92512,3-linked SA.
the IND05-HAN182K ... viruses bound more efﬁciently to /H92512,6- linked SA than the same amino acid substitutions in their original background
the N182K substitution described by Yamada et al.resulted in limited /H92512,6-linked SA binding in the original study, but abundant /H92512,6-linked SA binding in the IND05-HA back- ground
viruses with the N182K, Q222L G224S, or N182K Q222LG224S substitutions in HA showed sole /H92512,6-linked SA receptor binding preference
Mutations in H5N1 inﬂuenza virus hemagglutinin that confer binding to human tracheal airway epithelium.
a single amino acid change in hemagglutinin altered its recognition of sialyloligosaccharides.
Transmission of inﬂuenza virus in a mammalian host is increased by PB2 amino acids 627Kor 627E/701N.
Haemagglutinin mutations responsible for the binding of H5N1 influenza A viruses to human-type receptors.
